steps.description: Customer receives an in‑app and email notification that their trade has failed, including error code and next steps.
steps.businessRationale: Immediate error visibility reduces customer frustration and prevents repeated failed attempts, protecting revenue and trust.

steps.description: Customer chooses a support channel (live chat, secure message, or phone) to resolve the failed trade.
steps.businessRationale: Providing multiple support channels increases resolution likelihood and reduces abandonment of high‑value trades.

steps.description: Support agent or automated assistant reviews the failed trade details, error logs, and market conditions.
steps.businessRationale: Trade failures require cross‑system checks (order routing, market data, account balance). Accurate diagnosis prevents repeat failures.

steps.description: Support resolves the issue by retrying the trade, correcting account data, or advising the customer on next steps.
steps.businessRationale: Timely resolution directly impacts revenue because failed trades represent lost dealing fees and potential customer churn.

steps.description: Customer receives confirmation that the trade has been successfully executed or alternative actions have been completed.
steps.businessRationale: Clear confirmation reduces anxiety and reinforces trust in the platform after a failure event.

steps.description: HL sends a follow‑up message with a summary of the issue, resolution details, and optional feedback survey.
steps.businessRationale: Follow‑up reduces churn risk and provides insights into systemic issues affecting trade reliability.
